The goal is simple: use your poker skills to win chips and outlast your opponents.

Just specify your actions using these exact commands:

Pot: 30 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: []
P0 (Dealer/BB): 990.00 chips | bet 10.00 | active
P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: 8♣, 10♦
==============================================
rounds.response:
Hand 1 – Pre-flop  
Effective stacks ~ 990 vs 980  
Pot 30, to me 10 more

My hand
8♣ T⋄ – offsuit, unsuited, below-reg average but can flop decently with straight-draws.

I’m out of position (Big Blind), villain has initiative and positional advantage.  
With 8-T off I’m slightly behind a typical open-range (~35-40 %). I do not want to inflate the pot out of position with a weak holding.

Decision: complete the 10-chip call to see the flop cheaply; folding is too tight for one more blind and raising is riskier OOP.

[Call]

rounds.response:
I have 8♣ 10♦ and the flop is K♣ 3♠ A♣.  
That board is very coordinated: two Broadway cards, an ace, and a flush draw.  
My hand is just ten-high with no flush draw and no straight draw, so it’s far behind any reasonable holding.  
With the pot small and no realistic way to win, the proper play is to check back and see the turn for free.

[Check]
